author: needs-coffee
body:
## Steps to reproduce
- install OpenSSH client for windows - either the windows release through add/remove features, or latest binary from [repo](https://github.com/PowerShell/Win32-OpenSSH/releases/tag/V8.6.0.0p1-Beta)
- open powershell core (v7+) directly and ssh to a linux server with `ssh 192.168.50.55`
- The provided MOTD from the server is either printed once (as intended) or repeated twice. 
- This does not happen on every connection but will reliably happen every few connections.
- This does not happen from windows CMD, powershell (native windows installed version), PuTTY or any linux client. 
- Occurs on multiple servers with different distros, OpenSSH server versions and configurations.
- This does not happen from powershell core when opened from within windows terminal - only from the native executable. 
- This happens on the included openssh version 8.1 and the latest binary release 8.6 (which included a fix from the ssh side for this in Powershell/Win32-OpenSSH#1736 )
- This does not happen when the Powershell core window is maximised - it only happens when in a non maximised window

## Expected behavior
SSH MOTD is printed once and only once on connection.

## Actual behavior
SSH MOTD is printed once or twice on connection to a linux server when opened from powershell core. 

## Environment data
OpenSSH_for_Windows_8.1p1, LibreSSL 3.0.2 
OpenSSH_for_Windows_8.6p1, LibreSSL 3.3.3 (8.6.0.0)
Connecting to - Debian Buster, Ubuntu 20.04, Ubuntu 18.04, raspbian buster
